widgets_values:
## Workflow Notes Â· Using Your Trained LoRA

This workflow supports **three equivalent ways** to load a LoRA.  
Choose **one** based on where your LoRA file comes from.

---

### 1. Get the LoRA path and load it into the workflow

#### **Option A Â· RunComfy training result (recommended)**
Use this if the LoRA was trained on RunComfy.

- Go to **[RunComfy â†’ Trainer â†’ LoRA Assets](https://www.runcomfy.com/trainer/lora-assets)**  
- Find the LoRA you want to use  
- Click the ðŸ‘‰ **â‹® (three-dot)** menu on the right  
- Select **Copy LoRA Link**  
- Paste the copied URL into this workflowâ€™s custom node field: **`lora_path`**

This method uses the **cloud LoRA asset** directly â€” no local files required.

---

#### **Option B Â· AI Toolkit LoRA trained outside RunComfy**

- Copy the **direct `.safetensors` download URL** of your LoRA file, then paste it **directly into `lora_path`** in the **RC FluxDev** node.

- The **RC FluxDev** node will automatically fetch and load the LoRA at runtime â€” there is **no need to manually download the file** or place it into `ComfyUI/models/loras`.

- Tip: Make sure the link points to the actual `.safetensors` file (not a web page or redirect).

---

### âš ï¸ Important Â· FluxDev access & Hugging Face token required

FluxDev models require **explicit access authorization** on Hugging Face.

Before running this workflow:

1. Make sure your Hugging Face account has been **granted access to FluxDev**  
2. Create a **Hugging Face access token**
3. Paste your token into the **`hf_token`** field in the **RC FluxDev** node

Without a valid token and model access, the workflow **will not run**.

For step-by-step instructions, see:  
https://www.runcomfy.com/trainer/ai-toolkit/huggingface-token-flux-ostris-ai-toolkit

---

### 2. Match inference parameters with your training sample settings

If you customized any values during training (for example):

- `seed`
- `guidance_scale`
- `trigger_words`
- `sample_steps`

make sure the corresponding nodes in this workflow use the **same values**.

> **Note**  
> If you did **not** customize sample parameters during training, you can keep the current workflow defaults.  
> If you trained this LoRA on RunComfy, you can find your YAML config easily on the **[LoRA Assets](https://www.runcomfy.com/trainer/lora-assets)** page.

---

### Quick checklist

- âœ… `lora_path` points to a **directly downloadable `.safetensors` file** generated by **AI Toolkit training** (RunComfy LoRA link or an equivalent direct file URL)  
- âœ… **FluxDev access granted** on Hugging Face  
- âœ… Valid Hugging Face token pasted into **`hf_token`**  
- âœ… Inference parameters match training **`sample`** config (if customized)

If all items are correct, what you see here should closely match what you saw during training previews.
